tournament.name: Fuguete Champ 247 - Play Point P/ Top 10

decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on using cheap, aggressive creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker to apply early pressure and force the opponent into a defensive position. With a suite of burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Fiery Temper, and Chain Lightning, the deck can deal direct damage to the opponent or remove blockers. Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize help with card advantage and maintaining aggression. Alms of the Vein provides additional reach and life gain, while support lands like Razortrap Gorge and Bojuka Bog disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently utilize the Balustrade Spy combo to get key creatures into the graveyard, allowing for powerful graveyard recursion and card advantage through spells like Exhume and Dread Return. This combo-centric strategy aims to overwhelm opponents with big creatures and value plays, utilizing cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Lead the Stampede to further enhance the deck's performance. The deck also includes support cards like Masked Vandal and Mesmeric Fiend to disrupt opponents and maintain control of the board.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent by using aggressive creatures and spells while also disrupting their strategies with removal and disruption. The deck aims to control the board with a mix of creature removal, card draw, and graveyard hate, while also generating value through sacrificing artifacts and bouncing creatures. By constantly pressuring the opponent and disrupting their game plan, this deck aims to come out on top in a 1 vs 1 scenario through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, quickly reducing their life total to zero. By playing efficient creatures and utilizing direct damage spells, the deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible before the opponent can stabilize. The key strategy involves playing multiple low-cost creatures early on to build a strong board presence, while using burn spells to remove any blockers or finish off the opponent. The deck's synergy between creatures and spells allows for a fast and powerful attacking strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by consistently drawing cards with creatures like Sea Gate Oracle and Mulldrifter, while also countering opponent's spells with Negate and Prohibit. The deck utilizes the Ephemerate card to protect key creatures and generate extra value. Meeting of Minds allows players to draw even more cards, while Snap can help to deal with threats on the board. The inclusion of Archaeomancer and Ghostly Flicker allows for card recursion and additional value. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency and smooth gameplay.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By ramping up mana with cards like Arbor Elf, Utopia Sprawl, and Wild Growth, the deck aims to quickly play powerful threats such as Avenging Hunter and Eldrazi Repurposer. Malevolent Rumble and Thermokarst provide removal options, while Writhing Chrysalis can disrupt the opponent's game plan. The combination of fast mana acceleration and high-impact creatures makes this Gruul Aggro deck a formidable force in the Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing creatures that deal damage upon entering the battlefield and spells that can target the opponent directly. By combining cards that can deal direct damage with others that generate additional value, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can set up their own game plan. This deck prioritizes efficiency and speed to secure victory in a quick and decisive manner.

This Mono Blue Aggro deck focuses on using low-cost creatures like Faeries and Ninjas to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes various counter spells and removal cards to control the board and protect its own creatures. By efficiently utilizing card draw and evasion abilities, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The strategy revolves around aggressive early plays and maintaining tempo throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of low-cost artifacts and creatures while disrupting their strategy with removal spells. By utilizing the Affinity mechanic to reduce costs and generate card advantage, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace and apply pressure from the early turns of the game. The inclusion of cards like Candy Trail and Fanatical Offering provide additional synergy with the artifact-heavy strategy, allowing for explosive plays and unexpected burst damage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the pieces needed to execute the Balustrade Spy combo, which involves milling your entire library into your graveyard and winning the game by reanimating a creature like Lotleth Giant. The deck includes cards that help ramp up mana quickly and find combo pieces efficiently, while also providing some backup win conditions. The focus is on setting up and executing the combo as early and consistently as possible to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The main goal of this Dimir Control deck is to slow down the opponent's strategy while gaining card advantage through counterspells and card draw. By using efficient removal spells and disruption, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Snuff Out and Brainstorm help to efficiently deal with threats and ensure card advantage. With a mix of reactive and proactive cards, this deck seeks to establish a dominant board presence and control the pace of the game until it can secure a win condition.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly and efficiently bring out powerful creatures while also disrupting the opponent's game plan through various spells and abilities. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells, taking advantage of the affinity mechanic to make spells and creatures cheaper to cast. The deck also includes cards that provide card draw and recursion to maintain momentum and outvalue the opponent. It aims to close out games quickly by establishing a strong board presence and dealing direct damage to the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with artifacts and use them to power up cards like Galvanic Blast and Myr Enforcer for aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Ichor Wellspring and Thoughtcast to draw cards and generate value, the deck aims to maintain a steady flow of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Nihil Spellbomb. The inclusion of cards like Krark-Clan Shaman and Black Mage's Rod helps to provide additional removal options and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. The goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent while continuously dealing damage with cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Fiery Temper. Faithless Looting helps to filter through the deck and find key cards, while Highway Robbery and Grab the Prize provide additional ways to deal damage and control the board. Overall, the strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature and burn damage.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tolarian Terror to quickly put pressure on the opponent. It also includes counterspells and bounce spells like Boomerang to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to draw into more threats and answers. With a low mana curve and a focus on tempo plays, this Mono Blue Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

This aggressive white deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It includes efficient creatures like Thraben Inspector and Kor Skyfisher, along with support cards like Thraben Charm and Prismatic Strands to protect the creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and maintain a strong board presence to quickly finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. With a focus on speed and efficiency, this deck aims to win through sheer numbers and relentless aggression.
